title: Lida93
author: Lida93
content: Recently I have been mining with a lot of different cryptocurrency platforms that looks so promising and real to work out eventually as claimed. How I got to encounter these alt coin mining platforms (am not sure if the right word to use is platform) was through a good friend of mine whom which we're in same shit together due to a pressing need that needs a lot of money for us to procure for our proposed business.He has been introducing me into lots of these mining platforms he gets from some persons he meets online, who claimed to be paying them for lots of months, and so for a people that needs money to run a pressing need we will both engage into it out of desperation, we will end up buying a mining machine from these platforms with even the little money we have that was supposed to be a starting point of savings to our proposed business plan. To cut the whole story short, we have engaged into four different platforms just in the past two months which initially only one paid just ones and crashed, the very last one we had to purchase the platform mining machine for $250 only to get bursted like the previous ones within a space of two weeks while waiting for the 30days interval for eligible withdrawal.Although I believe there might be some real genuine mining platforms that are really trustworthy and paying but I can't say for sure which is genuine. Am just using this to remind people out here to be very careful and exercise some patience in doing some few research about these kind of issues or as it relates to this kind of situation. Our desperation has really cost us even the little we had in the process of getting more.Despite all of these, we are still unperturbed and will really welcome any real genuine mining Â platform that is trusted and working as we're in really need of funds for our business plan, but this time I'll put in a lot research work on whatever comes out way to know it's trustworthiness before involving.Thank you!This is a story told by someone I came in contact with in a conventional business meeting I attended within the weekend as we were having a group discussion. The purpose of bringing this here is to bring to the knowledge of some beginners and even old users in the forum about such platforms, and to create awareness of careful even in desperate times. Further more I promised the fellow that I was going to get back to him with probable solutions to what he's looking for, and so I'll really appreciate anyone in the forum that can give any genuine information on this so I can get back a feedback to the fellow.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on September 21, 2022, 03:18:56 PMHe has been introducing me into lots of these mining platforms he gets from some persons he meets online, who claimed to be paying them for lots of months, and so for a people that needs money to run a pressing need we will both engage into it out of desperationAfter I read this sentence you're just telling about cloud mining where you're a investor who doesn't know what the person you trust and what he doing with your money, I think trusting to cloud mining is a stupid decision, it's better if you mine yourself considering you're want to mine altcoins where it's easier than mine Bitcoin.I think the only advice from me to you and anyone else, never put your money in cloud mining since it's 99% scam.

comments.author: Lucius

Sometimes, in terms of deception, the user gets the first or second payment, but only to buy a bigger and more expensive package that will never pay off.Quote from: Lida93 on September 21, 2022, 03:18:56 PMHe has been introducing me into lots of these mining platforms he gets from some persons he meets online, who claimed to be paying them for lots of months...Your friend is himself in the wrong about all this, or he is knowingly dragging you and others in because of the profit he makes from referrals. Mining, online friends and business offers, perfect scenario to lose a lot of money.Quote from: Lida93 on September 21, 2022, 03:18:56 PMFurther more I promised the fellow that I was going to get back to him with probable solutions to what he's looking for, and so I'll really appreciate anyone in the forum that can give any genuine information on this so I can get back a feedback to the fellow. It was said far too many times. It's just nice websites showing numbers and mining nothing.Some act like Ponzi schemes and may pay a little at first, until they catch a big enough number of fishes. Then they close and that's all. Or may even ask for more money from those who were depositing, maybe they're stupid enough and let themselves get scammed further.No.There were in the past legit cloud mining companies. 1, maybe 2-3, I don't know. But I don't think that any legit cloud mining is still operating. And even if it would work, investing there is still foolish, since one may get ROI one week after the end of the world.So it's also no.If one wants to earn from mining, he has to actually get the hardware and mine. Of course, one has to do the math, since in many countries the electricity is too expensive and mining will go at a loss.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: in the end, I didn't understand you, have you invested in such platforms yourself or are you still in doubt about what to recommendHowever, the answer to your question is very clear and simple. there is no platform that can offer you mining only through the website, all cloud mining is scams and you should stay away from it. regarding the recommendation of a service to a third person, my advice is not to do that. for every failure, they will accuse you of losing, and you certainly don't want that. Especially if you only recommended it and you have no profit from it. and it doesn't have to refer only too obvious scams like cloud mining, some big platforms have gone and their users have run out of money.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: just a warning that you might receive PM's from scammers encouraging you to join their cloud mining, ignore the, they are scams, just like what other members have said. if you are really interested in mining, you might want to ask how to build your own mining rig. there are members here that could give tips on how to properly do so.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: 100% of all online "mining platforms" commonly known as Cloud Mining services are scams using Ponzi scheme to earn money. But some of them have actual hashrate though. The problem with this type of "business" (with actual hashrate) that relies on small investments from users is that it is very unprofitable. So at some point they have to turn into a Ponzi scheme (sell more hashrate than they actually have) to increase their profitability. But obviously that can not be sustained since at some point they have to pay their users back the money they don't have.This is why even if you found a cloud mining service that could prove they have actual mining hardware and were really mining cryptocurrencies, you should still not trust them.

But I don't think that any legit cloud mining is still operating. comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: If you're still interested in doing something like this, maybe switch to staking or farming instead. It is risky but it at least has more chance to give you some profits when you time your exit and enter correctly. Running your own node to farm some coins is also more profitable (albeit needs a large amount of capital to start with) compared to cloud mining, for most of them at least.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on September 22, 2022, 05:14:39 AMWith that said OP, mining bitcoin or even altcoins can be profitable if you know what you're doing. Cloud mining on the other hand? Either a scam, or a total waste of money.Even then, it's usually more than just plugging in, and raking in the profits. You should be considering a lot when you're going into mining. Especially anticipating drops, as well as rises. So, if you're operating on a minimal amount of profit, it's probably worth considering whether it's worth it at all. Although, the price of mining machines usually price out anyone that has cold feet, since they're rather expensive. Altcoins are probably the more lucrative market in terms of mining, and then later converting that to Bitcoin. However, that also comes with additional risks.
